t: A Psalm. A Song at the dedication of the house of David.
I*pn will extol You, O Lord,*s for You have lifted me up, And*ld have not let my foes rejoice over me.
O*ld Lord*s my God, I cried out to You, And*ld You healed me.
O*ld Lord,*s You brought my soul up from the grave; You*ld have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
Sing*ln praise to the Lord,*s you saints of His, And*ld give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
For*ld His anger is*i but*i for*i a moment, His*ld favor is*i for*i life; Weeping*ld may endure for a night, But*ld joy comes*i in the morning.
Now*ln in my prosperity I said, “I*ld shall never be moved.”
Lord,*sld by Your favor You have made my mountain stand strong; You*ld hid Your face, and*i I was troubled.
I*ln cried out to You, O Lord;*s And*ld to the Lord*s I made supplication:
“What*ld profit is*i there*i in my blood, When*ld I go down to the pit? Will*ld the dust praise You? Will*ld it declare Your truth?
Hear,*ld O Lord,*s and have mercy on me; Lord,*sld be my helper!”
You*ln have turned for me my mourning into dancing; You*ld have put off my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness,
To*ld the end that my*i glory may sing praise to You and not be silent. O*ld Lord*s my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
